alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 2:32AM PST until February 03 at 11:01AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The Skokomish River will recede today then rise again tonight with more heavy rain possible in the Olympics. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:15 AM PST Tuesday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 16.4 feet late this evening. It will then rise above flood stage late tonight to 16.9 feet late Thursday morning. It will fall below flood stage again early Saturday morning. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 11/23/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1045 AM PST.
